name: Appam with Stew
description: Soft hoppers made from fermented rice batter, served with vegetable or chicken stew.
instructions: Soak rice and grind with coconut. Add yeast and sugar, ferment overnight. Cook in appachatti. Serve with stew.

name: Kerala Fish Curry
description: Spicy fish curry cooked with coconut and tamarind.
instructions: Fry onion in coconut oil, add spices, tamarind, and fish. Cook until done. Serve with rice.

name: Banana Chips
description: Crispy fried raw banana slices, a classic Kerala snack.
instructions: Peel bananas, slice thin, deep fry in coconut oil until golden. Sprinkle salt and store airtight.

name: Chicken Roast
description: Kerala-style spicy chicken roast with coconut oil and curry leaves.
instructions: Marinate chicken with spices, fry onions in coconut oil, add chicken and roast until dry.

name: Beef Ularthiyathu
description: Dry-fried beef with coconut slices, spices, and curry leaves.
instructions: Pressure cook beef with spices, then stir-fry with coconut slices and curry leaves.

name: Vegetable Thoran
description: Dry stir-fried vegetables with grated coconut.
instructions: Chop vegetables, cook with coconut and spices on low flame until dry.

name: Avial
description: Mixed vegetables cooked with coconut and yogurt, seasoned with curry leaves.
instructions: Cook vegetables, grind coconut with chilies, mix with curd and curry leaves.

name: Sambar
description: Traditional South Indian lentil and vegetable curry with tamarind.
instructions: Cook dal, add vegetables and tamarind water, simmer with sambar powder.

name: Unniyappam
description: Sweet rice flour fritters made with banana and jaggery.
instructions: Mix banana, jaggery, and rice flour. Fry small portions in appachatti until golden.

name: Parippu Vada
description: Crispy lentil fritters made with spiced chana dal.
instructions: Soak dal, grind coarsely, mix with onion and chilies, deep fry till crispy.

name: Puttu and Kadala Curry
description: Steamed rice flour cylinders with grated coconut, served with black chickpea curry.
instructions: Steam rice flour with coconut in puttu kutti. Serve with kadala curry.

name: Palada Payasam
description: Traditional Kerala dessert made with rice ada, milk, and sugar.
instructions: Boil milk, add rice ada and sugar. Stir until thick and creamy.
